name: Nick Major
education: Bachelor of Computer Engineering, University of Guelph (2018).
profile: As a highly capable and self-starting professional, I apply strong organization skills while demonstrating initiative and a solid work ethic.

projects.title: IoT Real Time System Project
projects.subtitle: University of Guelph
description: Demonstrated strong project management skills and team collaboration while using Agile to develop a working prototype (IoT sensory network) for inventory management in assembly manufacturing.
Implemented 3-layer architecture, splitting problems into three main components, including sensory network, backend (server), and frontend (website).
Used observable pattern (Rx.js) with Angular.js to create frontend, which kept over architecture event-based.
Secured Node.js backend service with JSON web tokens and HTTPS.
Used MongoDB database with Mongoose to store user and sensor data, which provided schemas for structuring data and implement type casting, validation, and query building.
Created scalable wireless sensor network to communicate with backend in real time to trigger component replenishment, avoid stockouts, optimize inventory levels, and forecast future usage.

projects.title: IoT Hydroponics System Project
projects.subtitle: University of Guelph
description: Found a solution to remotely monitor and manage miniature hydroponics farm, while under a three-week time constraint.
Used Raspberry Pi as web server to control Arduino with temperature, humidity, and relay sensors.
Used various communication protocols, including MQTT, Websockets, and HTTP (REST API).

projects.title: Caremunity Android App Backend Project
projects.course: System Analysis and Design in Applications
projects.subtitle: University of Guelph
description: Worked on a team of four to design and create a backend service for Android app to help people with FASD take medications.
The project followed a waterfall design process, completing each step-in turn and planning and documenting all progress.
Created backend service using Node.js, Postman, and MySQL to fulfill requirements.
Worked with clients through product development with paper prototyping and wire-framing.

projects.title: iCal Database Project
projects.subtitle: University of Guelph
description: Demonstrated sound time management skills while working on a four-stage project (parser utility library, command line extension, Python GUI, MySQL database).
Overcame barriers from tight timelines, debugging, fixing bugs in lengthy programs, and learning Python and MySQL
Worked with various features, including I/O, C to Python extensions, and server functionality.
Developed specification reading skills by breaking down and implementing project requirements.

work.title: Co-op Position
work.subtitle: Pencom Canada, Cambridge
description: Worked with quality assurance (QA) department programming a Keyence machine (image dimension measurement system).

Improved inspection process by designing a Java based program to aggregate parts specifications (drawings and Excel) and Keyence programs. Additionally, implemented a partial search by using part information from the main system for easier location.
Designed fixtures for scanning in parts and a jig for in-house assembly product using SolidWorks. Measured parts and made sketches.
Created instructions, wrote manual, and trained warehouse staff on Keyence machine and Java program.
